info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 01 at 1:10AM CDT until June 01 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FOR BOURBON AND NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD COUNTIES... At 110 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Redfield, or 8 miles west of Fort Scott, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fort Scott... Marmaton... Bronson... Uniontown... Walnut... Fulton... Redfield... Hepler... Mapleton... Harding... Pawnee Station... Hiattville... Petersburg... Hammond... Devon... Garland... Porterville... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
